D_IRuVBqqkg3t8WMeYQURQ.text: Very disappointed in the customer service. We ordered Reuben's  and wanted coleslaw instead of kraut. They charged us $3.00 for the coleslaw. We will not be back . The iced tea is also terrible tasting.

a11CC4NmI9F4_g3pGp2Y0A.text: This would be my local haunt, if I were ever to relocate to the Pittsburgh area. What a great little place! Such friendly staff, and some damn good eats!   It was so great, that we actually went there twice during our 4-day vacation to catch the Steelers/Ravens game.   They have daily sandwich specials. On Thursday night we went and had the special roast beef and cheese sand., and the .35 cent wings. Very, very tasty. I'm sorry, but this place kicks Primanti Bros. butt on the taste factor. They have about 8 different types of wings... reg., garlic, and I can't remember the rest - we got the regular, and I was wishing we would had ordered more.  Going back on a Friday night, we ordered the buffalo chicken pizza and a pepperoni n' mushroom.  Wow! That buffalo chicken pizza was awesome.  The other thing that stuck out for me was one of the customers. An older gentleman; he seemed to be a regular. I really, really wanted his SPAM t-shirt.

Tost6UsjSKkkz6Um5tOYcQ.text: 9/6/2013  Dinner today - at a bar and grill,  a very busy place filled with locals and families.  The service is quick and friendly; the food good.  It was a bit on the noisy side, but the good kind of noisy.  Of course the TV's were all on the sports channel, which no one was really watching at the time.  A good place that gets 4 stars mostly because of the atmosphere and because we liked it.  It doesn't look like much from the outside, but it is the inside that counts.

Kvn8sdj20YW1BhAcCmUxIQ.text: A great townie bar with tasty food and an interesting clientele. I went to check this place out on the way home from the airport one Friday night and it didn't disappoint. It is refreshing to walk into a townie bar and not feel like the music stops and everyone in the place is staring at you - I'm guessing the mixed crowd of older hockey fans, young men in collared shirts, and thirtysomethings have probably seen it all during their time at this place.   The staff was top notch - the orders were somewhat overwhelming as they appeared short-staffed for the night, but my waitress tried to keep a positive attitude for my entire visit. The other waiter was wearing a hooded cardigan, and I wanted to steal it from him due to my difficulty in finding such a quality article of clothing.  We ordered a white pizza - large in size, engulfed in cheese, full of garlic flavor, flavorful hot sausage. An overall delicious pizza, aside from 2 things: 1, way too much grease (I know this comes with the territory, but still, it is sometimes unbearable); 2, CANNED MUSHROOMS - the worst thing to come out of a can. Ever. I would rather eat canned Alpo than canned mushrooms. And if the mushrooms weren't canned, they were just the worst mushrooms I've ever consumed. The mushroom debacle is enough to lower the review by an entire star - disgusting!  My advice for the place is keep everything awesome - random music from the jukebox, tasty food, great prices, good crowd and staff - and get some decent mushrooms; why they spoil an otherwise above average pie with such inferior crap, I'll never know.

gtAzDqmjtbjgJeyV9XZLfQ.text: Grew up near here. the family would always go once a month. Haven't stopped in for a few years until last Friday with a few friends to grab a drink. The sandwiches are always amazing just as I remember. The staff is amazing and friendly. Great place for lunch as well.

lJKkJ0QrdcaP68f0aWlVeQ.text: Good beer selection. Understaffed for a light Monday night crowd, it wasn't her fault she was the only server. But it took about an hour to get our sandwiches. Mine was one of the best reubens I've ever had.

rGEkz4xC4VVl31I0tvjHoQ.text: Awesome drink specials during happy hour. Fantastic wings that are crispy and delicious, wing night on Tuesday and Thursday!

sTwCUfWHjXQcRVmv30Ddog.text: Alexion's has been around forever.  The first time I went in there, I was 19 years old on summer break from college and working at the ice cream factory up the hill.  All of the union guys from the ice cream factory went in there after work, and I immediately found out why.  MANY, MANY years later, I stopped in there with some fond memories, and once again felt welcomed and valued as a customer, even though they didn't know who I was.  THE SANDWICHES are done Pittsburgh-style, sort of like Primanti's, and they are as perfect today as they were back in ancient times when I first started visiting the place.  Alexion's is a clean and peaceful little place in the Rook Station part of Green Tree, the oldest part of the town.  I recall that some of the sandwiches I got there were ordered at a pretty late hour.  Nothing but good things to say about the place, and I wish it was closer to home!

OT47QgoKc4wFl2zAOSWp2Q.text: It's a nice family bar with a hometown feel to it.  They are good people there.  Great food and service.  I don't go often,  but owe an apology and a tip.

5KC_x9_f-3MZa_UyTDZo6A.text: I go here to get away and enjoy a nice drink and great company. The service is always top notch and customer service is awesome. First class management and food.

FcMjAMTzbi6i_fu_N4ZMDQ.text: What a cool bar/restaurant.. I will no doubt be visiting again.  The service and prices were great.. and the restrooms were clean.   I had the buffalo chicken sandwich and it was delicious.  The menu consists of typical bar food food, however; theres a few different items on there which stand out on the menu..  A cool bar off the beaten path that is a worth a trip.    Cheers ! !

jkOCC0dZq33tk3g26IDSsg.text: I will be back. Drank and dined here Saturday afternoon, March 2nd, while staying at a nearby hotel for a chess tournament. Went to this place on a tip from a friend and was not disappointed. We had wings, a cheeseburger, and fries. Everything was perfect (except for the celery that came with the wings - not sure what was going on there).   The decor is classic Pittsburgh, but the bathrooms were small (unless there were more located in the back room that I did not see). I think it would be a nice place to watch the game. I would like to go back when they are busy to see if it is as cool as I think it would be, and I probably will soon.

uMKGdRqxPHarFWjH3agNgQ.text: This place, by far, has the BIGGEST sandwiches. I'm a hog, and I have to order a "half," which is the size of a full size sandwich elsewhere, especially the cold cut and the braunsweiger, my personal favorites. Wing night Tuesday and Thursday, oh yea. Lots of craft beers on tap. My old man orders the bar pie pizza (white) and he loves it. Go here. Just do it.

rCFyPf-NtJ7wI7a6sYPelQ.text: great little bar on the off beatin path in greentree, pa.....stopped in here wed. nite for a quick one and what a gem in the rough !!.... i met malarie the bartender and she made me feel right a home......( sorry mal if I spelt your name wrong...) the bar was packed for a wed. nite and everyone was friendly  ....didn't get a chance to eat here but the food looked great.....next time...the menu had a nice choice and prices were great !  the bar was clean along with the restrooms

ep56KTryABqsv3Ajh8IjVg.text: Fantastic! Great food, excellent beer selection!  Bartenders are great! It is a great hometown neighborhood bar with good people and friendly staff.  The food is a good selection of var type food with large sandwiches.  Excellent wings!

jFhYMp2ueB2mhaAAc24gnA.text: Found this place on Yelp and glad we did. Great beer selection, the sandwiches are wonderful and huge, wings were very good. Family owned establishment and everyone we met was great, the owner, waitstaff and kitchen staff.  If we ever get to The Pittsburgh area again, we will go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. The Tom Wedgie. Wholly Cow!

BIRZUonn3GorBpmX2TNMgg.text: Friendly staff, good food, great beer selection, and relaxing atmosphere. Great wings and the buffalo chicken pizza is the best I've had. The sandwiches are all on thick cut Italian bread and fresh. Definitely  a hidden gem of the Greetree/Carnegie area. Looking for a low key hole in the wall with good prices and great food this is your place.

OrK2FhKTMg445oINQtUvRQ.text: Burger was amazing...chips were meh. We went into this place starving after a long day of traveling and it was exactly what we needed. Divey and fun!

COA51xoO-djbq2UNIvx02Q.text: Good for cheap drinks and wings, they offer daily specials which is nice.   Doesnt look like much from outside but the inside is friendly enough, the bartenders have been there for awhile and do a good job. Dont expect to have a HUGE selection of alcohol.   Their wings are good as are their salads. If you are gluten free this is not your place...lots of fried food and sandwiches.  Offers a quick lunch.

5w9IQ53AYmpnJcr8p7F8qw.text: Friendly local bar with great service and good food,  won't be disappointed if you like bar food at a reasonable price.  Good place to go for "Friday fish sandwich "

ADkuUZl2mh7hv7a1DPPs0g.text: Very friendly service, good atmosphere, and the food was good too. I had the barbecue wings and some Guinness Stout on draft. Unfortunately, they didn't have anything for dessert.

G7pLnrHtDYIKrlO0DCIuDw.text: I think they poisoned my food.  So sick.  I ordered a burger and asked for cheddar cheese. The waitress told me it's not an option for the burger although it's on the menu. I said I wasn't really that hungry anyway and not to worry about it. I guess she talked to her manager and said they could add cheddar to the cheese burger. I said ok. I ate about half my burger and started feeling violently ill. I was nauseous and my stomach had the worst cramps I have ever felt. I went to the bathroom just in case.  I had to leave and hope I made it home in time before anything left my body........  laid down the rest of the night in a ball in excruciating pain. Work up the next morning an felt fine. What ever it was - was unlike anything I have ever experienced before.  This has never happened to me in any other establishment or ever before. It was not an illness and I suspect something was put in my burger because I requested cheddar cheese. I felt compelled to leave a review warning other people what might happen if you request a modification to your food here. I will never go there again. I'm scared to.

2_toG0mBZXmpUwq0OicVdA.text: I ate here a few years ago and wasn't really impressed. Yesterday a couple friends invited my wife and I here for drinks and a bite to eat. I had the Reuben and I loved it. The meat was perfect and the bread while not grilled with butter like a typical Reuben was delicious. The bread was soft and fresh and the dressing came on the side so it was nice to just pick it up and eat it without having greasy hands. Everyone else got burgers and they looked really good. I'll definately try one next time but it will be hard not to get that Reuben again. Overall typical bar food menu, service was ok ( didn't get water and had to ask for silverware ). Will definately be back soon though

mRN-S7goOVm7VD7BSHBaHg.text: The only thing I've ever ordered from here was the wings and they were so good. Crispy and tons of sauces to choose from. This is our new go to for wings!

OywJcBKW06E7LSxTKhCCcg.text: The sandwiches, the wings, enough said. Alexions can best be described as a home-style Primantis before they went mega commercial. You really can't go wrong, but for my money, I would put Alexions fish sandwich up with the best I've had. That's not to take away from other selections, but if you come here I recommend not leaving until you've had either the fish sandwich, Reuben, or wings.   You'll know you're in a Pittsburgh bar when you walk in. For someone who lives in Atlanta now and only makes it to Pittsburgh a few times a year, I have to say it is refreshing. Feels like home. I haven't had a trip back without making it out to Alexions at least once.

oPBWyqc0ehZTA0HHe-CpdQ.text: The bar is nice enough the servers are attentive enough the food is good enough. Their is absolutely nothing wrong with this place but the problem is it is not a place that will stick out from the crowd. It's kind of lost in the crowd. Pittsburgh is a city full of bars this one is relaxed. It's a great neighborhood bar. And I would come back but it is not a wow that is a great place.  It's just good enough

BFsJ7CZx6d4vtUTqCshmAQ.text: We met a couple of friends there on a Friday afternoon about 440 pm, based on the Yelp reviews. I've relied on Yelp in over a dozen different cities, never came away with anything less than a positive experience until today.   We ordered within 5 minutes of sitting down, there couldn't have been more than 20 people in the place, counting the people on the patio.  Took them almost 40 minutes to serve 3 sandwiches and a salad. I tried the fish sandwich, came out fried extra crispy on the ends, if there is such a thing as fish jerky a third of the sandwich would have qualified, it was just ok. I've had better at almost any church that fries fish during Lent.   All 3 of my dinner companions left partial sandwiches  or salad uneaten. Bread french fries and onion rings were good though. Iced tea was good, though I've never seen a place dispense sweet n low like they were giving away their last rock of crack. Asked for sugar but never saw any, they don't carry any other artificial sweeteners besides the pink stuff.  I may give the place another try in the future for a Reuben or hamburger, assuming today was some aberration possibly due to a cook having a family emergency or something like that. Waitress was pretty good, held up under my multiple requests to find out if they caught my fish yet, hardly ever rolled her eyes :)

leqRzE7QZA6G40oV9_sDTA.text: Stopped in here as it was close to my hotel.  Great local pub. Service was great, food was definitely above average. Would recommend the wings for sure. Will be back next time I'm in town.

ec4GQIYuISiLnN0HR1eVCQ.text: Wow. I had the toms wedge because I saw the picture here on yelp.  Lived up to my expectations and far exceeded them. Why does not more places make a pizza wedge sandwich!!!!!  Made my day! Thanks!!!!

3VMJ_7DKYoNGnWRrYlHcrA.text: Alexion is my new favorite local spot. Everything that my Girlfriend and I have ordered so far was Amazing! The wedges, calzones, burgers, wings, and Reuben have all been fantastic! One of the best beer selections in the area and a friendly, fun loving staff. Seems like every time we go out anymore Alexion is at the top of our list. We enjoy Blinky's, Hop House, Vincent's, and Manny's, but all are taking a backseat for the foreseeable future.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. I don&#39;t care where you&#39;re from, or what you do. Alexion&#39;s Pizza Rolls are better than any you&#39;ve ever had.
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Perfect Calzone, picture makes it look smaller.
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Steak Wedgie with Hot Peppers, awesome!!

POfb7eUXhuh0c1IsaZzLGw.text: This is a great local bar, excellent staff, very friendly, very attentive to the needs of their guests. They've got a great happy hour and run daily specials on food all the time. I consider the pepperoni roll here to be the best in Pittsburgh! I'm a big fan of the buffalo chicken sandwich too, very simple, but yummy. Another great thing about this bar is for most drinks you aren't paying Pittsburgh prices. Things are very reasonable as far as drinks go. I'm not a fan of beer, but if you are. They have 20 beers on tap including ipa's, ales, Stouts/porters & as well as others. UPDATE: They feature a happy hour Monday through Friday from 5 to 7 and even on Saturday from 8 till 10! Plus daily food specials. Just a heads up the kitchen is now open 7 days a week usually opening at 11 a.m. they close at 10 p.m. Monday through Thursday, midnight Friday and Saturday, and 11 p.m. on Sunday. If you're looking for a great place to stop and there's tons of hotels around here, within walking distance or cheap Uber distance, this is a great place to go!   Enjoy  Dig

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Taps galore, I think 20 or so

Bs1W_s5ukysa9dbEer9nmQ.text: Hidden gem! The food was excellent. Service was great and we really enjoyed our dinner. Great beer choices as well.

M7tuCAIe5fAzL_yRu19SzQ.text: The BEST local hangout.  Super friendly atmosphere with great tap selection and awesome bar food.    My favorites are the Tom Turkey sandwich, Turkey salad and the fish. Although I have rarely been disappointed with the food.    A must to check out!  Great Pittsburgh neighborhood bar!!

7zzrEWNEroSEsFSNFPLxfw.text: Was looking for somewhere to eat close by since we were staying in the Pittsburgh area.  Alexion's was on the list of places to eat given to us by the hotel.  We decided to give it a try and were pleasantly surprised.  The first thing I noticed was how clean it was inside.  We were shown to a table right beside the bar, where there were a few patrons were enjoying their drinks, albeit a little too much.  Had the pizza, wings, and cheese steak with mushrooms.  The food was really good, all but the canned mushrooms on the cheese steak.  Would have preferred fresh mushrooms, but the fresh italian roll made up for it.  More than willing to try Alexion's again.

XGr0RAOQ4gMbKEfp2pU-Xg.text: Fun dive bar with great food. If you are in the area and don't want to put up with a smoky bar, this is the place.

H5D3EXESCpL6o4lzMrbR6w.text: Cheap and delicious. We came here for a late lunch starving. Left here so full and satisfied! I ordered the deluxe chicken salad with breaded chicken and ranch. The breaded chicken was so crispy and flavorful. The table ordered the garlic Parmesan wings and they had chunks of garlic on them! My fiance had the tom's wedgie which he loved. I had a bite and can say it was generously made. Their sandwiches are huge and under $10. I definitely can't wait to come back to try more.

T-nIpXjmUEIEcKL3OzhDoQ.text: I am in town on business, by far best meal of the entire trip. Had a custom turkey sandwich.. best of my life!

molizdrI8LFJ6EO26_8ifg.text: I love this place! The bartenders & food are awesome! The manager Timmy is such a great guy and will make sure you're taken care of! I cant wait to come back!

-c6kC7RVgEVCnaVe-D86Ig.text: I've lived close to Alexion's for over a year and took me that long to give it a shot. Amazing bar food-huge sandwiches and cold beer. Awesome spot and cool-Pittsburghy decor!

pjgJb0rHXq2wEoFem8C2Rg.text: Enjoyed lunch and the pretty solid beer selection. Food was a few notches above bar food and the service was great. We recommend and will stop again next time we are in the area.

hHwI1mfPxkPoaXXxEnV80Q.text: Excellent burger and fresh cut fries.  Also the bartender was a delight and the service was excellent.  Very sociable and cool neighborhood bar that I will return to when staying in the area

4I3oIsh2lngS5ygXaAY5qA.text: Great bar! Food is always consistent and good. Staff is amazing and friendly. Nice, neighborhood bar atmosphere. Come in and ask for Timmy!

oE7qF3DDzU-a7fhfrHAC6A.text: This place has a real neighborhood vibe to it, and offers a nice selection of brews along with a decent menu if you're here for a meal. Comfortable decor, decent service and reasonable prices make this a good spot for a sojourn if in the area. The bartender was cool in offering samples of drafts before I selected, and the food (I had wings and zucchini planks - both excellent) was very good.

tqLLUVRLS3UR9hTo7ccQ0w.text: Perfect joint! Don't be afraid as you pull up... It's a nice little neighborhood. Was in town on biz and my hotel was right up the street. Great service, well apportioned servings and unique menu make this place worthy of a check in!

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States

URHgYUIpqVqnXrXoAqVNYQ.text: I usually love your food but today I had a delicious Italian delight but my 3 dozen wings to go were SO over cooked.  If I was there I would have sent them back for all the money I spent. What a disappointment

0c9m9wzBqUAEcBdZIJD9vw.text: Nice patio area. Really good food -- and very large portions. We got wings, a reuben, and a huge salad.  Great selection of beers too. We'll definitely be back!

oI4tCffays5vsIC9FhCSbw.text: Great local spot! Ruben was amazing. Great craft beer on tap. Super friendly staff Nothing bad to say at all!

Hh8lf8_sRqGS4-g0DSyZbQ.text: Waited over 30 minutes to get our drinks which never came so we left.  And never even had our order taken for food while waiting.  I understand being busy but not even coming by to explain or manage expectations is unacceptable.

m1OkGj4ld7Z4rObOZKR7tA.text: Our waitress was extremely sweet and zucchini strips and calzone was very good. We will be back,we live 1 hour away.

I2Z6AwpupZpJCfVkv1ff4w.text: I've been trying to find a GREAT veggie burger in Pgh for years. This is my new favorite place for the aforementioned. Do yourself a favor and give it a try. Load it up with whatever you want but this is a MUST: ask for it on their special sesame Italian bread. It's incredibly satisfying. If youd like to find a phenomenal vegetarian alternative to a cheesesteak from Primantis, add provolone to the above and thank me later veg ppl. The owners are good ppl; this is a local business very much worth supporting. Alexion's does not disappoint.

zK5LRGDrZuN8h31x74Nwcw.text: Inv#: 0175112 Open 12:27PM My wife & I visited on a Monday, on the way home from The Strip. Her "Grl Chix Salad" was more than likely cooked, frozen, microwaved to an anonymous state; regardless, it was tasteless & inedible. My "Rachel" was a chewy "fight" of a sandwich. I pulled, out of my mouth, as much as I chewed and swallowed. Our waitress didn't have time to hear us: She was good; but, barely had time to deliver our check, let alone hear about the crappy, tasteless salad or the chewy, tough Rachel. I posted a questioning review in April '17. Questions have now been answered. Contact me when things change, for the better! chettacka@gmail.com

Rsbh7X9C2M6kFtKU6ssjMg.text: This place has large portions for the right price. Italian wedgie is good but I would ask for more Italian dressing on the side. Bacon cheeseburger was huge, tasty and came with a side of chips. Can't go wrong w bacon cheese fries. They get sandwich bread made fresh daily from Shop n Save. Huge slices, but too bready for me. I'd suggest skipping on the Rueben. Fried fish was good during the week but not great on Friday. Mac and cheese is watery so definitely skip it. Buffalo calzone with breaded chicken was good.

NqLfzMDXH1wEyQS9xQUQIQ.text: Came in 3:30 pm.  Only about 8 people. Very NOISY!  Everybody yelling their conversation.  Too noisy to stay and eat late lunch.  Never saw it like this before...drunks at 3:30 in the afternoon?  Will try again, another time.

HKx5HNEt0wjGu_mOxlq0YQ.text: A typical bar with bar type food offerings. I had a pizza which was very good and hubby had a buffalo chicken salad with grilled chicken. There was no spices or sauce  on the chicken to even resemble buffalo chicken so that was a little disappointing. But all in all a decent experience. Great wait staff.

rDDzBlk4ABMtOX45QJHJ-Q.text: I went to Alexions with a co-worker/friend for lunch during lent.  First impression, it was small and packed.  This is apparently a very popular lunch stop.  They have a nice outdoor seating section, but it was closed due to the weather.    I opted for their Friday special a fish sandwich with cheese, hold the cheese.  I hate cheese on fish, in my mind it doesn't go well together.  It came with one side and chips.  I opted for cole slaw because that does go great with fish.  The chips were straight out of a bag.  I am not a chip fan, especially not one that Lay's delivered.  It would have been nice to have homemade chips.  The special was 10.50, so I was hoping it would be good.  The wait wasn't terrible for as busy as they were, but if you're on a strict time schedule for lunch I'd call ahead.  The food arrived in about 20 minutes.  My fish sandwich though nice size was a little small for the price, compared to other's that are cheaper.  The slaw was nice, good flavor but the fish was average.  I loaded it up with some tarter and cocktail sauce to help the flavor out.  It wasn't a bad sandwich just a tad small and mediocre for the price.  I would stop back to try something else another time and would love to grab a beer here, as they had a really decent selection, and the servers were also pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Friday fish special

IB8lKfnooEArgmrbV85Osw.text: Food is FANTASTIC! Service is always fast too. Great little bar/grill to grab a sandwich for lunch or wings for dinner. Doesn't look like much, but whoever is cooking back there knows what they're doing. I've gone several times and it's always delicious. Burgers, deli sandwiches on soft Italian bread, salads, big portions at a great price. Idk what else to say, go here.

qNWCQiMFvs3G6YNKelZCag.text: Finally made it here after years of wanting to go. Neighborhood bar with decent craft beer selection and really good 'bar food' that's reasonably priced. Bartenders and servers are very friendly and helpful. Every Pgh neighborhood has one, you need to find them and go, - often! In Crafton/ Carnegie it's Alexions!

-uBbUZdQUxVvrosItXN6FQ.text: Great place to eat food was great portion size is awesome great beer selections. Server was great a must stop if in greentree pa

OrjLZ_aq0_bB_cNgnugxdQ.text: I was so pleasantly surprised by Alexions! I don't want to define it as a dive bar because that wouldn't fit, it's simply a neighborhood bar/restaurant that hasn't had a hipster remodel.  And it doesn't need one!  Great food--flavorful, fresh, and at affordable prices.  I came here on a Wednesday when it was $1 off craft beers and personal "bar" pizzas (could easily feed two) were $4.75, both great deals.  All in all I was able to drink and eat for around $20, you can't beat it.  Also, fast and attentive service.  Parking is a breeze with two gravel lots on each side of the building.  Without a doubt will return again.   Side note, the bar is non smoking but smokers will are able to smoke on the patio.

wUi_kOBRPhyJUvU9oNjizA.text: Great beer and pretty good wings.  Rarely in the area but would definitely go back next time.

BKTX9mpLIQl8Imdz__QdYw.text: We were in Greentree so decided to give this place a try based on good YELP reviews.... well one things was right...beer is ICE Cold in frosted mugs.   Food was also awesome... started off with mozzarella sticks, an Italian wedgie, toms wedgie and a build your own sandwich...... every thing we ordered was so good!  Happy to find a new place to add to our list... we will definitely be back.  Oh and service was excellent... which is a deal breaker for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States

_ypUyfSZjVXnoXH33vxeHw.text: Great prices for good drinks & food! I'm not a fan of dark, crowded, noisy bars. Go there with friends because the place has a lovely patio area (covered porch) and we can sit & drink &  eat & chat &  actually hear each other. We usually share a pitcher  or 2 but  Alexion's does offer a very, very good selection of craft  & other bottled beers.   Food: always tastes fresh & is well prepared. Pizza good, their wings are generally unusually large (very good garlic parm!) &  all the other offerings always good.  Sandwiches & salads- large & tasty especially for the price! Another  big plus is easy, ample, off street parking.                      **Best is the excellent service! A super friendly &  good staff!** Honestly, is just a good local bar. It is not family oriented. It's a bar for adults...leave the kids with a sitter!   It's  just a very good local joint, very Pittsburgh in spirit & service.

INZrKAE9QtLSxUA03pbNkQ.text: I have visited twice around dinner time. Both times I feel like they were significantly under-staffed. The service was slow and the wait staff expressed how busy they were (meanwhile I personally thought it was a typical dinner crowd). I was happy with their food, beer selection and prices.

QpJmDu792fVu6QHK6i7Hng.text: Huge tasty portions, not priced badly. Had half of the Italian and my husband had the Pittsburgher, both were delicious and filling.

Aphw-CJN_lx9vD2vB_yvcw.text: Great steak sandwich and great local bar. We frequent it after each local game that we coach. Great staff and great food/beer selection

PR4mAPKUh3IhuJNqE4jn7g.text: Was in town for business, saw the good reviews on yelp for this place, and they were accurate. I had Tom's wedge and it was delicious and huge. They also have a nice selection of craft beers

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Tom&#39;s Wedge

Fb7kGPVaQwRoP8FOvAhbqA.text: One of my friends and I like to go here on Sunday nights. They are usually a little busy and the bar reflects a family atmosphere. We are always greeted by the staff and made welcome. The beer is always nice and cold. The food is nice and freshly made and they have a great sandwich special, a chicken sandwich with fries and your choice of homemade bread. Prices are very reasonable and we always walk away with a goodie for lunch tomorrow. Highly recommended!

NOQuIZKwB346HItqwBO4iA.text: Great bar and restaurant!! It doesn't look like much from the outside but the service and food were fantastic. TVs playing with football games and a great atmosphere inside. Our server was so helpful and friendly. The menu was extensive and the portions were huge, especially for the price. The calzone was so delicious and the burgers were great also. If you are staying in Pittsburg I would definitely recommend this bar for a meal. Booths, lots of parking and free WiFi are available too

0yXWe2i290rbXP_GVnAmEA.text: While visiting Pittsburgh to see a friend we stopped by the little gem. First off, the staff is very hospitable. Awesome atmosphere and felt very comfortable. Now to the food......  THE WINGS. I consider myself an avid buffalo wing fanatic. This place had some of the best original buffalo wings I have ever tasted. They were perfect size and cooked to PERFECTION.  We also got the pepperoni rolls and pretzels. Both were delicious.  Overall, if you are a wing fan and in the area of this beautiful city, I suggest you stop by.

bQhX_kIt9BnqJXm7ploW8w.text: Not sure if we caught them on a bad night or what, but we had a less-than-stellar meal at this low-key neighborhood bar.  After a ,ong day of moving our daughter in to her new college apartment, we needed a quick and casual dinner someplace near our hotel. I scoured Yelp for recommendations and this spot popped to the top of the list.  We sat at a booth table in the bar area and settled in with our beer and cider orders. Server was a nice kid and he took good care of us along with others from the staff who chipped in as needed. The vibe there is very "local" where the servers seemed to know everyone who came through the door (except us! ha!) and folks appeared to be having a good time.  On to the meal review, however. We ordered a house salad, a burger to share and an order of wings. The salad was chopped lettuce, carrots and cabbage and was clearly from a bag. Nothing special to say the least. Our standard cheeseburger was most likely frozen and thrown on a grill given its shape and how it was cooked, but it was served atop a terrible, chewy bun straight out of a bag. The saving grace to the meal were the buffalo garlic parmesan wings, which we found pretty decent with a mild tangy flavor from the sauce and parm cheese combined.  Wish there was more to say about this place...although the atmosphere was chill, the food left a lot to be desired.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Buffalo garlic parmesan wings
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Cheeseburger
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. House salad

rOxFs8GlH6wlRXjnx9WQ9g.text: We randomly stumbled across this place and it doesn't look like much on the outside but the reviews I read seemed promising so we decided to just see what happened.   They were super busy but only had one person working the bar/tables. However, she was very on top of things and worked quickly so no complaints here.    The atmosphere has a very "local bar" feel which I love. I ended up getting their 'wedgie' which is a sandwich made with pizza dough. It was super good. I had more of a chicken sandwich and I think opting for something with more flavor such as salami would have paired nicer with the dough. So, I am going to opt for that next time!   Great food, beer on tap, service, and price. We plan on going back soon when we just need a place to kick up and enjoy some solid food.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States

VihuZMOUlurT3QY38h2NvA.text: Ordered a personal white pizza with their hot sausage and green peppers! Soooo tasty and the crust was PERFECT! The bartender was super nice and on top of everything (especially since she was the only one on the floor!) kudos to her!

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. White pizza with green peppers, tomatoes and sausage was EXCELLENT!!! Perfectly crispy crust!

UoKTBwwgFT6ZQqsYO6dbag.text: Food was ok. Had the Rueben Calzone.  Large portion, tasted great but the Corned Beef was very tough. May have gotten overcooked as the Pizza Dough for the calzone was baked.  Local place with friendly service and reasonable prices.  Had side salad. Fresh and nice portion size.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Ruben Calzone yummy

4J-jnV9dCyXJ01ZrgfDjHQ.text: Great neighborhood bar/restaurant. Great food though additionals like extra sauce etc are very overpriced.

E1RURLxNHDVkcLMrUw7Evg.text: My office was down the street and often I would walk over and grab lunch.  Sometimes would grab drinks with coworkers at the end of our day as well. They really have a pretty phenomenal bar/restaurant style menu. It's basic bar fare but the way it's prepared takes it to another level. Fries with nacho cheese sauce-yes, please. Chicken parm sandwich-yes, please. Pizza-yes, please.

4782LmalaGjAbirMQDhcjQ.text: A real laid back place with a lot of cool servers and great service. I would recommend you build your own sandwich and enjoy the vibe.

dsBSMVHleHfMAGfYhR0lNw.text: First time visiting Alexion's. Our server Blaze was awesome. Prompt, non-hovering, friendly demeanor and yoooo!! Our food came out in like literally 6 minutes. I ordered a jalapeno cheddar burger and my bae ordered a veggie burger. The veg burger isn't a bean type, but more of a patty, but tasty nonetheless. I asked for tomato slices for my burg and added the side pickles and this jam is LIT. Finished it off with a session IPA on the patio. Mmm mmm gerrdd!

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. View from the patio
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. -Jalapeño Cheddar Burger (I asked for tomato and tossed on the side pickles) -Veggie Burger -Large Fry

sliyCE_8vE3umvfg7w1e4g.text: Nice hometown spot! Great sandwiches, nice beer selection as well.

MY0Pbp-66_lBY6pUJ-nf-w.text: Where do I even begin:  At the moment of arrival, the outside of the establishment looked like a building in foreclosure, as it was dim and insipid.  As I entered the building, the restaurant was pumping loud rock music from every corner of the building, which obviously made it hard to communicate with the waiters(but I'll get there in a moment).  A group of close friends and I sat on the couch seats, which seemed old fashioned and a little outdated. To my surprise, the place was PACKED with people.  Our waitress(who seemed to be the only one as she was running around the whole building checking on the customers), finally approached our table and asked what we would like to order. One of my partners asked for a salad and the other asked for the chicken tenders, while I ordered the smokehouse burger.  I knew there should have been suspicion about the food, since the waitress had a difficult time describing the salad to my partner, having only said "it's like what's in a regular salad" and recited a list of what is suppose to be in a salad, such as lettuce, dressing, and to my partners surprise, pickles.  A solid 30-45 minutes had passed and the food had finally came, well, to everybody accept my order. As my partners were experiencing in on the salad and the chicken, I waited another 3 minutes for my smokehouse burger to arrive. And I was SHOCKED.  What my eyes detected first was the use of white toast bread( uncooked and not even toasted), When I expected the traditional brown buns to appear. The smokehouse burger consisted of onion rings, teriyaki sauce, bacon, and cheese, which luckily it had all the components.   The burger was too big to put in a human-sized mouth. I have made a couple of attempts to eat the sand which like a burger, however the size of the burger was overpowering. I asked my waitress for a fork and knife to help dissect this behemoth.   As fast as I had put the food in my mouth was the same speed I wanted to spit out the bite. First. The teriyaki sauce was inconsistent with the burger, as there were large patches of the sauce in some areas of the burger while the others were scarce. The onion ring was probably made with poorly made batter and the crust couldn't hold on to the onion itself. The bacon, however, was crisp and it is what you would expect from bacon, light, tasty, crunchy.   Now here's the real disappointment. The party itself was BLAND. Absolutely no seasoning in it, not even salt and pepper. The cook of the burger was well done and I couldn't take another bite from that sandwich.   Aside from my plate, my partner had tasted the table ketchup and she found a weird taste in it. I took a sample of the ketchup in the bottle and it tasted old and warm, which should not be a characteristic of ketchup.  And to top it all of, one of the customers sitting at the bar was arguing over the loud music to another customer and at a server. We stopped paying attention, grabbed our things and left. Never coming back.

u7sgLioT07Dl-n4lmbav_w.text: Meh. Understaffed and inattentive. Ok craft draft list. I suspect a lot of food is food service. Ask if food is made there or if off a truck. Neighborhood joint

8a4hjyNJSozwNfes1zifgg.text: Came here for a birthday party, which was held in the upstairs room. It was a bit crowded up there, but our group made the space work. The service was excellent. The servers had to run up and down steps carrying drinks, food, and taking orders. They were incredibly friendly and did a wonderful job. The pizza was delicious and the wings smelled SO good, although I did not have any. We were a little sad to see there is no dart board here, but other than that we had a great time.

vs48bo8OvcxB1G2aPwlT-g.text: Soooooo good!! Tried going here last week around 600 and due to a party on the 2nd floor, it was packed with a 3 couples ahead of us so we left to try again today. We snagged a booth when you first walk in right across from the bar. Per the reviews on Yelp, we ordered Toms wedgie, and some fries and wings.  Toms Wedgie: Seriously the BEST thing I have ate at a restaurant in a long time! The wedgie is half a pizza crust folded over packed with toppings depending on what you choose. It's a PIZZA CRUST!! 5/5 Wings: We ordered the Buffalo Parm, they were ok, but dry. 3/5 Fries w cheese: Not really expecting something miraculous here, average 3/5 I will definitely go here again, and more than likely order Toms Wedgie again. I wish I caught the Servers name, but had to point out that she was extremely friendly and attentive the entire time we were there. Soooooo.... Server who I can't remember her name: 5/5

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Fries w cheese
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Menu

aTju6mfhM6fceqd8xEt_WQ.text: I never would have found this place if it weren't for Yelp, and I'm so glad I did! After seeing everyone's picture of the wedgie's I HAD to get one.  Luckily my boyfriend and I split one, cause they are HUGE! I didn't quite know what I was getting myself into when I ordered it, but this thing is like a giant sandwich, but the bread is PIZZA CRUST! I was so pleasantly surprised when I figured that out! We tried the steak wedgie and it was soooo good! It also happened to be wing night which is Tuesdays and Thursdays.  Wings are 40 cents...super cheap and super yummy!   This place is definitely a sporty, divey, casual place to come for a drink or bite to eat, but I think that's part of its charm.  The staff was very friendly but I did have a bit of trouble getting prompt service which is the only reason I didn't give 5 stars, but hey, it could have just been an off night, and the food was worth the wait! Definitely give this place a try, you'll be happy you did!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Tuesday and Thursday are 40 cent wings! Left is Cajun dry rub and right are buffalo Parmesan garlic. Buffalo Parmesan garlic wins for sure!
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Steak Wedgie...a sandwich with pizza crust for bread! You need to try one!

CDKZ2wsaP34sC9gQKDFN_Q.text: Love love love. Perfect hometown bar atmosphere, super friendly service and yummy eats. Having two of those talked about Wedgies (though you could easily share one), side of coleslaw and 4 microbrew drafts, set us back only $44, which felt just right. We saw many baskets of wings go by, which do look baller and they have like 8-10 different sauces.   We arrived at about 6pm on a Friday and it was busy! We were able to nab the last parking spot in Alexion's small lot (maybe about 10 spots) and found one of the last few bar tables open inside, though they do have a small outdoor patio to the side by the parking lot. By the time we left about an hour and a half later, it had died down, presumably before the night time drinking crowd moves in.

y1GrZZ1Iq_PboetUJ869eA.text: If you want a Drink then it is probably ok other than that kinda of a Dive with a week menu.

Sqp47kbCGdK2B1SRteAZSQ.text: OMG....from California....the wings  are awesome ...40 cents per on Tuesday and Thursdays...bbq cajun ate buffalo parmesan...i have died and gone to wing heaven...wayyy better than Buffalo wild wings..and beer from tap is ice cold and in frozen  glass!! Pub atmosphere..fun, loud, and just what i wanted!! Pretzels are the best i have ever had. Pizza rolls are homemade and looked delicious. You will not be disappointed...and service...the best. Wish we had this place in Menifee Ca. I'd be a regular!!

qXxPKbmKHeWX8-V7A-NtKg.text: This is a great little pub that is located in a residential neighborhood.  That just doesn't happen in NC so we were pretty intrigued by the location.  We arrived on a Tuesday evening at around 6:30.  We sat in a booth as soon as we arrived.  Our server arrived right away with menus.  She was super helpful with beer selection.  She brought us several samples so we could make a tasty choice.  For dinner , I knew that I wanted the steak salad with fries (you can't get fries in your salad in NC).  My husband had the nights special which was a steak sandwich and fries.  The food was good and the service was great.  If you are in the Greentree area be sure and stop by.  It's a great little pub.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Deluxe Steak Salad

4_S8VdA23s3HO1nQGgAkkA.text: I ordered the cheeseburger special they have on Saturday.  It was good but the bun was to big for the cheeseburger.  Suggest getting a not a thick bun for the burger. Was a little disappointed that we only had once choice in cooking of the burger. Some one else in the party order a reubens and it was okay.  They also need to get bigger table because four people can not sit at one table.  The French fries where really good.  Pickles where the best things.

photos.caption: Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Cheeseburger
Photo of Alexion's Bar & Grill - Carnegie, PA, United States. Reuben sandwich
